title: A hotel room in NYC for $15 a night? Believe it
text:
A hotel room in NYC for $15 a night? Believe it Hudson New York 
The lobby of the Hudson New York, with the lighted escalator on the right. 
The lobby of the Hudson New York, with the lighted escalator on the right. (Morgan Hotels Group) By Mary Forgione 
The Hudson New York near Central Park is having one of those anniversary flash sales with impossible-to-beat prices. The hotel in a vintage building turns 15 this year, so it's giving away 15 stays for $15 a night. 
It's also giving out 95 stays at its 2000 opening price of $95 a night. (As a comparison, I checked online and found midweek rates in August for a standard room start at $239 a night, plus taxes and fees.) Hudson New York 
The popular Sky Terrace at the Hudson New York. 
The popular Sky Terrace at the Hudson New York. (Morgan Hotels Group) 
There are blackout dates and other caveats that come with the online-only sale. But if you're lucky, you may snag a standard room when the sale begins at 9:01 p.m. Pacific time Wednesday (that's a stroke after midnight Thursday on the East Coast). 
The Hudson , less than a block from Columbus Circle, started out as the American Women's Assn. Clubhouse in 1928. It has been many things since then, including a Henry Hudson Hotel in 1941, a place where Dutch soldiers were housed during World War II and the home of Sesame Street Studios in 1985. 
Ian Schrager and designer Philippe Starck had a hand in making over the hotel, which was purchased by the Morgans Hotel Group in 1997. 
It's perhaps best known for its period design, the glow of chartreuse-colored lights that guide you up a 30-foot escalator, and the Sky Terrace with views on the 15th floor.
